title: Feature Request: Sequence annotation:  allow restricting label set per document
body:
Feature description
---------
The total data set  I am dealing with has  a large number of possible labels (too many to fit elegantly in one context menu).  I am able to prune the number of labels required to annotate any given document. However I do not know how to inject this "filtering" mechanism into the doccano codebase.  
A really elegant way to provide this functionality might simply be to allow a "permittedlabels"  key  in addition to the {"text": "...", labels:[[span, 'label_val'], []...] , "permitted_labels": ["<>", "<>"...] }  when importing json formatted docs. Only the labels in this permitted list would be available in the context menu upon highlighting a piece of text. Any suggestions/fixes would be much appreciated. 

p.s. Apologies for this feature request which might very well be trivial to implement. I am a ml engineer trying to help our labeling team use doccano (great project..so thank you devs for the effort!).   As I am inexperienced with vue/frontend dev and despite knowing basic django I have been unable to figure out how to do this myself.  I would be happy if there is an easy way to provide  this feature... or if someone knows how to, and could guide me through it  I would be happy to do the work and submit the PR (if the repo maintainers think it would be a useful feature).
